subject: Dialer issue
botResponse: I can help you troubleshoot your dialer issue. Here are the most common solutions: ## Network/Connection Issues First, check if your network ports are properly configured: - Ensure these TCP ports are open on your firewall: **20708, 20808, 20718, 20818** - Verify your router allows both inbound and outbound traffic on these ports - If using VPN/proxy, make sure it's not blocking these ports ## Caller ID Verification Problems If you're having trouble with caller ID verification: - Turn OFF "Do Not Disturb" on your phone - Turn OFF "Ignore Unknown Callers" - Make sure calls aren't going straight to voicemail - Your caller ID must be verified before you can use the dialer ## Browser/Audio Issues (for Mojo Voice users) If using Mojo Voice: - Allow microphone access when your browser prompts you - Check that your headset and microphone are properly connected - Verify browser permissions are enabled for microphone access - Test your audio connection in the dialer settings ## General Troubleshooting Steps 1. Restart your computer and network equipment 2. Test your general internet connection 3. Check for any security software blocking the connection 4. Make sure you've completed account setup, dialer configuration, and data import Could you describe the specific error message or symptoms you're seeing? This will help me provide more targeted assistance.

subject: map mode question

botResponse: Map Mode in Mojo is a visual way to display your contacts and leads on an interactive map based on their property addresses. Here's what you need to know: **What addresses show up in Map Mode:** - Both residential and business addresses will populate on the map - The key requirement is that the address data in your contact records needs to be complete and accurate for proper mapping **Common Map Mode issues:** - If properties aren't showing up on the map despite having correct addresses, this could be a technical issue - Make sure your contact records have complete address information (street address, city, state, zip) **How to access Map Mode:** Map Mode is typically found within your contact management interface and allows you to: - Visualize where your leads and contacts are located geographically - Plan more efficient routes for door knocking or property visits - Better understand your market coverage If you're experiencing issues where Map Mode isn't working despite having correct property addresses, this may require technical troubleshooting. You can contact Mojo support for assistance with specific mapping display problems. Would you like help with any specific aspect of using Map Mode or troubleshooting mapping issues?

subject: List
description: What is a MOJO Training list
botResponse: Here's how to work with lists in Mojo Dialer: ## Creating and Managing Calling Lists **Creating Sublists/Sub-Groups:** 1. Go to Data & Dialer section 2. Select your starting Calling List/Group 3. Click the 3-line FILTER icon next to any column header 4. Enter filter values for columns like: - Listing Status - Status Change Date - City - Price Range - Any other criteria 5. Click the green "Save Sublist/Subgroup" button 6. Give your filtered list a descriptive name ## Filtering Options **Price Filtering (3 methods):** **Option 1 - Optional Dialing Filters:** - Select your list and click Power Dialer - Click "Optional Dialing Filters" on the right - Set price range in List Price filter: - Above specific price: Enter minimum in "From", leave "To" blank - Below specific price: Leave "From" blank, enter maximum in "To" - Within range: Fill both "From" and "To" **Option 2 - Column Filters:** - In Data & Dialer, find the List Price column - Click the Filter icon next to the header - Set your desired price range - Save results to a Sublist **Option 3 - Purchase Filters:** - Set price filters when buying leads in the Leadstore - Enter minimum price to receive only leads at/above that amount ## Using Your Lists **Starting a Dial Session:** 1. Click on your Sublist in the left panel 2. Click the green Power Dialer button 3. Review settings: - Caller ID display - Prerecorded messages - Number of rings - Easy Calling Mode 4. Check Optional Dialing Filters for additional criteria 5. Click "Start Power Dialer" This system helps you organize contacts and target specific prospects based on your criteria for more effective calling campaigns.

subject: Mojo Caller ID
description: When I call, my number shows up as â€˜REAâ€™ or â€˜Real Estate Agent.â€™ Itâ€™s hurting my pickup rate. Can you help me update my caller ID / CNAM so it shows just my name instead? Thank you,
botResponse: # Mojo Caller ID Mojo Caller ID is a virtual number service that provides you with a personalized, verified caller ID to enhance your calling campaigns and build trust with prospects. ## What is Mojo Caller ID? Mojo Caller ID allows you to use an alternative caller ID when making calls while still receiving return calls on your phone. It costs $10 per month per number with a month-to-month subscription. ## Key Benefits **STIR/SHAKEN Certification** - Calls are transmitted with attestation level A (the highest certification) - Recipients recognize your calls as authentic and legitimate - Results in better contact rates **Enhanced Performance** - **Personalized, Verified Caller ID**: Projects professionalism and builds trust - **Improved Answer Rates**: Verified, whitelisted caller ID increases likelihood of calls being answered - **Reduced Spam Labeling**: Fewer calls incorrectly flagged as spam - **Enhanced Caller Reputation**: Positions you as a trusted caller ## How to Add Mojo Caller ID 1. Navigate to **Settings** from the bottom left of your Mojo dashboard 2. Select **Caller ID/Mojo Caller ID** 3. Click the **Buy Mojo Caller ID** button 4. Agree to the terms and click **Proceed to Checkout** 5. Select your state 6. Choose an available Mojo Caller ID number from the dropdown - If your area code isn't available, click the link to submit a request 7. Enter a phone label (for your internal reference only) 8. Complete the purchase process ## Text Messages If someone sends a text message to your Mojo Caller ID number, you won't receive it directly. The Mojo Caller ID is designed specifically for voice calls and call identification purposes. Mojo Caller ID is ideal for sales professionals who want to maximize their contact rates and establish trust through verified, professional caller identification.

subject: Triple dialer subscription
botResponse: A triple dialer subscription in Mojo allows you to dial with 3 lines simultaneously, which can significantly increase your calling efficiency compared to single-line dialing. Here are the key things to know about triple dialer subscriptions: **How it works:** - You can make calls on 3 lines at the same time during Power Dialer sessions - This increases your talk time and overall calling productivity **Subscription management:** - You can add or remove dialer services (including additional lines) through your Subscriptions page - Access this by clicking the Account icon in the bottom left corner, then selecting Subscriptions - Use the plus (+) icon to add services or minus (-) icon to remove them **Important notes about switching dialing modes:** - If you switch from Power Dialer to Click to Call mode, the system automatically reduces to 1 line (since Click to Call is designed for manual, one-at-a-time dialing) - When switching back to Power Dialer, make sure to check and reset your line count to 3 if you want to use all your available lines **Billing considerations:** - Adding services is prorated based on your current billing cycle - Removing services takes effect immediately with no prorated refund - Best practice: Wait until the day before your next bill date to remove services to maximize your paid time Would you like help with managing your triple dialer subscription or have questions about how to use multiple lines effectively?

subject: Cancel

Select "Account" located towards the top right of the Mojo screen 3. Select the "Subscriptions" tab on the left side of the page 4. Click the "Cancel" button 5. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the cancellation process **Important Notes:** - Your cancellation will take effect after your next billing date - You may continue using the platform until that date - If you're temporarily not using the service (vacation or seasonal use), consider switching to the basic subscription for $10/month per user instead - this preserves all your data until you need to resume Power Dialing The cancellation process must be completed by the account owner through the Mojo platform itself.

subject: Expired Data Area
description: Selected Lynchburg Association of Realtors, but all of the records in his account are for the Roanoke Valley Association. He said they do overlap, but Lynchburg services the cities closer to him, whe
botResponse: To manage your Expired Data area coverage, you'll need to configure your target area settings during setup or modify them afterward. ## How to Set Up Your Expired Data Area **During Initial Setup:** 1. Navigate to Leadstore by clicking Leadstore on the left of the screen 2. Select Subscribe next to Expired Data 3. Choose your State 4. Select your MLS (this is crucial for getting data in your desired area) 5. Define your target area by selecting either: - Up to a 50-mile radius (as the crow flies) within your MLS area - Specific cities/zip codes you want to target ## Important MLS Selection Considerations **Make sure you select the correct MLS** - this is critical because: - Your chosen cities/zip codes must align with the MLS data coverage - Different MLSs may have overlapping coverage areas but serve different primary regions - Incorrect MLS selection can result in getting data for areas farther from your target location ## If You Need to Change Your Area If you're receiving data for the wrong area (like getting Roanoke data when you selected Lynchburg), this typically indicates an MLS selection issue. The data team may need to review your setup to ensure you're getting coverage for the cities closest to your target market. ## Data Delivery Details Once properly configured: - You'll receive up to 12 months of historical data immediately - New expired and off-market data posts daily (typically around 7am local time) - Data appears in your Properties lists in the Data and Dialer section - Leads are automatically sorted by listing status The service costs $50 per month per MLS. If you're having area coverage issues, contact Mojo support to review your MLS selection and ensure you're getting data for your preferred locations.

subject: Printing Limit?
description: Hello, I just received the error saying I have reached the printing and email limit and I cannot use this feature for 15 minutes... I have been a client for many many years and have never seen this... Why is there a limit for me to acces
botResponse: Mojo has implemented rate limits on printing and email features to protect system performance and prevent abuse. When you hit the printing limit, you'll see an error message and need to wait 15 minutes before the feature becomes available again. This is a relatively new system-wide security measure that applies to all accounts, regardless of how long you've been a client. The limit isn't related to an additional cost - it's a temporary restriction that resets after the waiting period. The 15-minute cooldown period is designed to ensure fair usage across all users while maintaining system stability. After the waiting period expires, you'll be able to resume printing normally. If you're consistently hitting these limits during regular business operations, you may want to consider batching your printing activities or spreading them out throughout the day to avoid triggering the restriction.

subject: Emails Template
description: After creatinga new template, how can I send my self a test email to confirm what I'm sending out?
botResponse: ## How to Create Email Templates in Mojo ### Getting Started 1. Click the **menu button** on the bottom left 2. Choose **Settings** 3. Select **Email** from the left menu 4. Choose **Templates** (second option) 5. Click **New Template** ### Template Options You can either: - **Create from Scratch** - Build a completely custom template - **Use Pre-existing Layouts** - Start with a template and customize it ### Setting Up Your Template **Basic Information:** - **Label:** Enter a descriptive name for internal reference (make it easy to identify) - **Subject:** Create your email subject line - **Optional Elements:** - Add attachments - Include CC or BCC recipients - Add subject tags to auto-fill contact information ### Building Your Email Content **Text Content:** - Start with the default paragraph block - Click "I'm a new Text block ready for your content" to access the text editing toolbar - Use **Merge Tags** to automatically populate contact information (first name, last name, address, etc.) **Layout Customization:** - **Rows tab:** Choose different layout configurations - **Content tab:** Drag and drop content blocks including: - Title - Paragraph - Lists - Image - Button - Divider - Social Links - HTML - Video - Email Signature (automatically added at the bottom) **Design Settings:** - Adjust content area width - Set alignment preferences - Choose background color - Select default font ### Testing Your Template After creating your template, you can send a test email to yourself to verify how it looks and ensure everything displays correctly. ### Using Your Templates Once created, you can use these templates for: - Manual emails to individual contacts - Auto Send emails based on call results - Action Plan drip campaigns - Birthday emails - Appointment confirmations Your templates will save you time and ensure consistent messaging across all your email communications.

subject: Subscriptions

subject: Dialer Not Working
description: Hi Mojo Support Team, I recently canceled the dialer portion of my subscription but kept the Neighborhood Search and Agent features. I only had the dialer for about a week, and during that time I ran into ongoing call quality issues where people ha
botResponse: I can help you troubleshoot dialer issues. Here are the most common solutions: ## Basic Troubleshooting Steps 1. **Check your browser compatibility** - Ensure you're using Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Safari, or Microsoft Edge 2. **Clear browser cache and cookies** - This resolves most loading issues 3. **Verify microphone permissions** - Your browser needs access to your microphone to function properly 4. **Test your internet connection** - A stable connection is required for the dialer to work ## For Mojo Voice Users If you're using Mojo Voice ($30/month add-on): 1. **Check browser permissions** - Make sure your browser has microphone access enabled 2. **Test audio connections** - Use the audio test feature in the dialer settings 3. **Verify headset/microphone** - Ensure they're properly connected and working 4. **Check Mojo Voice settings** - You can enable/disable Mojo Voice before each session ## Connection Issues If the dialer won't load or connect: 1. **Try connecting via the "Call Me" feature** - Wait for an incoming call at your specified number 2. **Use the PIN method** - Call the provided number and enter your PIN when prompted 3. **Check your call settings** - Verify your Caller ID and other configurations are correct ## Audio Quality Problems If people can't hear you or you can't hear them: - Double-check headset and microphone connections - Test different audio devices - Ensure browser microphone permissions are enabled - Try refreshing the page and reconnecting What specific issue are you experiencing with the dialer? This will help me provide more targeted assistance.

subject: Tasks
description: 1. When I try to use Mass Action via tasks or other option, none of the options become available 2. I want to delete ALL past tasks or follow up from 2016 to December 25th 2025. ---> Everything. It's all old stuff that wouldn't make sense anymore.
botResponse: ## Understanding Tasks in Mojo Tasks in Mojo are activities that help you stay organized and manage your follow-up workflow. Here's how they work: ### What Are Tasks? Tasks are scheduled activities that appear in your **Mojo Calendar** alongside other activities like: - Follow-up calls - Appointments - Letters and labels - Birthdays - Home close date reminders ### Accessing Your Tasks 1. **Navigate to the Calendar** - Located in the top navigation bar 2. **View Today's Activities** - Tasks will appear in the "Today's Activities Overview" section on your landing screen 3. **Use the Activity Stream** - View all tasks in your activity center on the Home Screen ### Managing Tasks **Individual Task Management:** - Click on any task to: - Reschedule for a different time - Mark as completed - Add notes or additional information - Use the three dots on the far right to complete or delete tasks **Mass Task Actions:** - Select multiple tasks using checkboxes - Available bulk actions include: - Mark as complete - Assign to different person - Print tasks - Mass reschedule - Export tasks ### Task Priority System Tasks use a color-coding system for prioritization: - ðŸ”´ **Red** - High Priority (immediate attention required) - ðŸŸ¡ **Yellow** - Medium Priority - ðŸŸ¢ **Green** - Low Priority You can sort tasks by priority in the Calendar view by clicking the Priority column header. ### Task Creation Through Action Plans Tasks can be automatically created as part of **Action Plans** - customizable follow-up sequences that help maintain consistent communication with contacts. When you assign an Action Plan to contacts, task steps are automatically scheduled and appear in your Calendar. Tasks help ensure you never miss important follow-up activities and keep your sales process organized and efficient.

subject: Imported leads
botResponse: I can help you with importing leads into Mojo! Here's the complete process: ## How to Import Leads into Mojo **Step 1: Choose Your File** - Click the "Choose File" button - Locate your spreadsheet file on your computer - Select the file and click "Open" - Mojo accepts XLS, XLSX, and CSV file formats - Click "Next" to proceed **Step 2: Select Import Destination** You'll need to decide where to place your imported contacts: **Choose between:** - **Calling Lists** - For general collections of leads you haven't spoken to yet (used for mass calling actions) - **Groups** - For leads with specific qualifications like hot leads, warm leads, future follow-ups, or past clients that you have spoken to **You can either:** - Create a new list/group by clicking the plus sign in the top right corner, then clicking Save - Add to an existing list/group by selecting it from the displayed options **Optional Settings:** - Manager selection (only needed if you have multiple agents) - Other configuration options as needed ## File Format Requirements - Supported formats: .csv, .xls, .xlsx - Make sure your spreadsheet is properly formatted before importing ## Auto-Import Option If you work with data vendors, you can share your 10-Digit Posting Pin (found in your Account area) with compatible vendors like Redx, Vulcan7, My +Plus Leads, Cole Information, and others for direct lead posting without manual imports. Would you like help with any specific part of the import process or have questions about organizing your imported leads?

subject: Duplicate telephone numbers on his Mojo FSBOs
description: see video attached to ticket
botResponse: To resolve duplicate telephone numbers in your Mojo FSBO leads, you can use Mojo's Find Duplicates feature: **How to Find and Remove Duplicates:** 1. **Access the Duplicate Finder:** - Log into Mojo and navigate to **Data and Dialer** - Select **"Find Duplicates"** from the options at the bottom of the page 2. **Set Your Search Parameters:** - Choose **phone number** as your matching criteria - Select your FSBO list specifically, or choose "Entire Database" if you want to check everything - Click the **Search** button to begin scanning 3. **Review and Manage the Results:** Once Mojo displays the identified duplicates, you have two options: **Option 1 - Link Records:** - Click the **chain icon** next to records you want to connect - This preserves both records while creating an association between them - If linked records are in the same calling list, Mojo will prevent duplicate calls to the same contact **Option 2 - Delete Duplicates:** - Click the **red X icon** next to any record you want to remove - This permanently deletes the selected record from your database - You can copy/paste important data from one record to the other before deleting if needed **Additional Search Options:** You can also search for duplicates by email, full name, or property address if you want to do a more comprehensive cleanup of your FSBO list. Regular duplicate management helps maintain data integrity and improves your calling efficiency by preventing you from calling the same number multiple times.

subject: Sessions Report
description: Hello, I am sorry to send in the same question, I am not sure if my other one was submitted as my computer lagged on me. I am reaching out in regards to why my dial count on my screen during my calling session than it is on the session r
botResponse: The Sessions Report is a powerful tool in Mojo for evaluating agent performance, especially in team environments. Here's what it provides: ## What the Sessions Report Shows The Sessions Report analyzes call results and time allocation with detailed breakdowns of: - **Total dialer time** - How long agents spent actively dialing - **Total talk time** - Actual conversation time with contacts - **Pause duration** - Time spent paused during sessions - **Call result frequency patterns** - Which outcomes are most common ## How to Access the Sessions Report 1. Go to the **Reports** section in the left menu bar 2. Select **Session Report** from the available options 3. Apply filters for specific agents or time frames as needed ## Important Note About Dial Counts If you're seeing discrepancies between the dial count displayed during your session versus what appears in the Sessions Report afterward, this is a known issue that can occur. The session display and final report may calculate dials differently due to various technical factors during the dialing process. The Sessions Report is particularly valuable for team managers who need to evaluate agent performance and identify areas for improvement in calling efficiency and results. Would you like help with accessing any specific aspects of the Sessions Report or understanding other performance metrics in Mojo?

subject: EXPIRED DATA
description: I have not received any expired data in over 2 weeks. Please explain as there has been multiple expired listings.
botResponse: # Mojo Expired Data Mojo Expired Data is a premium lead service that provides access to off-market property leads, including Expired, Cancelled, and Withdrawn listings, delivered directly to your Mojo Dialer. ## How It Works **Target Area Selection:** - Select up to a 50-mile radius (as the crow flies) within your MLS area - Choose specific cities/zip codes you want to target **Data Delivery:** - Get immediate historical data upon purchase (up to 12 months of current Expired and Off-Market data if available) - Receive automatic daily updates each morning - New data posts directly to your Properties list in the Data and Dialer section - Leads are automatically sorted into specific lists based on listing status **Smart Status Tracking:** - Your existing data is continually updated when listing statuses change - For example, if a property changes from Expired to Active, it automatically moves to an Active list ## Pricing $50 per month per MLS ## How to Subscribe 1. Navigate to **Leadstore** (click Leadstore on the left of the screen) 2. Select **Subscribe** next to Expired Data 3. Configure your area: - Choose your State - Select your MLS 4. Complete setup and payment ## Finding Your Data Your expired data will appear in the **Properties** section under Data and Dialer, organized into specific lists: - Expired calling list - Cancelled list - Withdrawn list ## Daily Updates Data pushes occur daily, typically around 7am in your local time (but can be later). If you subscribe after the daily push, you won't see new data until the following morning. This service keeps you ahead of competitors with up-to-date listing status changes, helping you maximize productivity and close more deals.

subject: Lists and dialer not loading
description: Lists were not loading, then one did, tried starting dialer but it was stuck in "preparing" tried to back out and it didn't stop had to hang up for it to let me out
botResponse: Here are the steps to resolve lists and dialer loading issues: ## Immediate Solutions **If you're stuck in "preparing" mode:** - Hang up the current session to force it to stop - Close your browser completely and reopen Mojo - This will clear any stuck processes ## Common Causes and Fixes **1. Large Data Volumes** - Lists with thousands of leads take longer to load, especially those with extensive notes or activity logs - Be patient with larger lists or consider creating smaller sublists **2. Browser Issues** - Update your browser to the latest version - Use Google Chrome with minimal extensions for best performance - Clear your browser cache and cookies, then restart **3. Internet Connection** - Check your internet connection speed and stability - Mojo is cloud-based, so slow connections cause loading delays **4. Cached Data Problems** - Close Mojo completely and reopen it fresh - Old cached data can cause loading issues ## If Problems Persist **Server Load Issues** If you've tried the above solutions and still experience problems, there may be temporary server load issues. These are usually brief and resolve automatically. **Need Immediate Help?** Call Mojo support at 877-859-6656 if the loading issues continue after trying these troubleshooting steps. Try clearing your browser cache first, then restart your session - this resolves most loading issues quickly.

subject: Dialer not working
description: power dialer configuration problem also not getting sounds or voice please resolve this issue assap
botResponse: I can help you troubleshoot dialer issues. Here are the most common solutions: ## Audio/Voice Problems If you're experiencing call quality issues or can't hear audio: 1. **Check browser permissions**: Your browser needs microphone access. When you launch a dial session, accept the microphone permission prompt 2. **Verify headset connections**: Double-check that your headset and microphone are properly connected 3. **Test audio settings**: In the dialer interface, you can select your preferred microphone and headset, then test your audio connection 4. **Browser compatibility**: Ensure you're using Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Safari, or Microsoft Edge ## Power Dialer Configuration Issues If the dialer won't start or configure properly: 1. **Check prerequisites**: - Account subscription is active - Dialer settings are configured - Data has been imported to your account 2. **Connection methods**: Try both connection options: - Wait for incoming call at your specified number - Call the provided phone number and enter your PIN ## Getting Started Steps 1. Select your Property List, Calling List, or Group 2. Click the Power Dialer button 3. Configure your call settings and Easy Calling Mode 4. Apply any optional filters 5. Click Start Dialing 6. Connect using one of the connection methods above ## Mojo Voice Specific Issues If you're using Mojo Voice ($30/month add-on): - Enable Mojo Voice in the dialer setup screen - Grant browser microphone permissions - Test your audio connection before starting What specific issue are you experiencing? Are you getting error messages, having audio problems, or is the dialer not connecting at all?

subject: Do not call scrubbing
description: Can I scrub a list looking for DNC numbers on a list that Import?
botResponse: ## Do Not Call Scrubbing in Mojo Mojo provides comprehensive DNC scrubbing capabilities to help you manage your Do Not Call list effectively. Here's how to work with DNC scrubbing: ### Accessing DNC Scrubbing 1. Click **Settings** on the bottom left of your Mojo screen 2. Click **Do Not Call** on the left menu 3. Click the **DNC Scrubbing** link ### Adding Numbers to DNC **To add a single number:** 1. Scroll to the bottom of the DNC Scrubbing page 2. Click the **Add Number** button 3. Enter the phone number in the text field 4. Click **Add** to confirm **To import a file of numbers:** 1. Click **Import DNC List** 2. Click **Choose File** and select your file (must be less than 5MB) 3. Check the box if the first line is a header 4. Select the appropriate file format 5. Use the dropdown menu(s) to choose the header(s) for the phone column(s) 6. Click **Import** ### Searching Your DNC List - Enter the phone number in the **Search By Phone Number** field to locate specific records - Use the 3 vertical dots next to results to **Preview** the lead or **Restore** the number ### Removing Numbers from DNC 1. Enter the phone number in the Search field to locate your record(s) 2. Select the record(s) you wish to restore 3. Click the **3-dot menu** in the top right of the display 4. Click **Restore From DNC** to confirm ### Adding Contacts from Data & Dialer You can also move contacts to DNC directly from the Data & Dialer screen: 1. Navigate to **Data & Dialer** 2. Select one or more contacts 3. Either click **Move to** at the bottom and select **Move to DNC**, or right-click and choose **Move to DNC** 4. Select the phone numbers you want to add to DNC 5. Click **OK** to confirm Once contacts are on your DNC list, the system will prevent these numbers from importing again and block outbound calls to these numbers.

subject: Map Mode Question
description: PIN: 754196 <span style="font-family: Helve
botResponse: Map Mode in Mojo displays contacts that have valid address information, whether they are residential or business addresses. Both types of addresses will show up on the map as long as the address data is complete and can be geocoded to a specific location. If you're experiencing issues where Map Mode isn't working despite having correct property addresses, here are some troubleshooting steps: **Common Solutions:** 1. **Check address completeness** - Ensure all address fields are filled out (street, city, state, zip) 2. **Verify address format** - Make sure addresses follow standard formatting 3. **Data refresh** - Try refreshing the page or logging out and back in 4. **Browser compatibility** - Ensure you're using a supported browser with location services enabled **For Data Import Issues:** If you imported the addresses and they're not showing on the map, the issue might be in how the address fields were mapped during import: - During Step 3 of import (Map Your Fields), make sure address fields are properly mapped to the correct Mojo address fields - Use separate fields for street, city, state, and zip when possible for better geocoding accuracy If your addresses appear correct but Map Mode still isn't working, this may require technical support to investigate the specific data formatting or account configuration.

subject: Callback forward change
description: Hi, how do i change the routing number to the Mojo caller ID number so that the callbacks are forwarded to the Mojo caller ID number instead of my number?
botResponse: To change your callback forwarding so that callbacks go to your Mojo caller ID number instead of your personal number, you'll need to set up call forwarding within your Mojo system. Here's how to make this change: **Access Your Settings:** 1. Log into your Mojo account 2. Navigate to your account settings or phone number management section **Update Callback Routing:** 1. Look for callback forwarding or call routing options 2. Change the forwarding destination from your personal number to your Mojo caller ID number 3. Save the changes **Alternative Options:** - You may also want to consider purchasing an additional Mojo number specifically for callbacks if you need more control over call routing - This allows you to have dedicated agents answer callbacks on a separate line If you're having trouble locating these settings in your account, I recommend contacting Mojo support directly as callback forwarding configurations can vary based on your specific account setup and subscription level. They can walk you through the exact steps for your particular configuration. The goal is to ensure that when prospects call back the number they see on their caller ID, it routes to the number you prefer rather than your personal line.

subject: Help with email font
description: Hello, My email template titled Step 14 S0 Action Plan is giving me problems with the font. No matter what font I change it to, when I send a test email, it looks like it was written with a typewriter. How can I fix this?
botResponse: Here's how to fix font issues in your email templates: **Editing Your Email Template Font:** 1. Navigate to **Settings** at the bottom left of your screen 2. Select **Email** from the left menu 3. Choose **Templates** 4. Find and open your "Step 14 S0 Action Plan" template **Fixing the Font Display:** 1. Click on the text block that's showing the typewriter-like font 2. Use the **font and size options** displayed above the text block to: - Select your preferred font family - Adjust the font size - Apply any other formatting needed 3. After making changes, click the **green Save button** **Testing Your Changes:** 1. Send a **test email** to verify the font displays correctly 2. If it still appears like typewriter text, try: - Selecting a different font from the dropdown - Clearing any copied formatting by retyping the text directly - Using the text formatting toolbar to override any inherited styles **Common Font Issues:** - Sometimes copied text brings hidden formatting that overrides your template settings - Try manually typing your content instead of copying/pasting - Ensure you're selecting web-safe fonts that display consistently across email clients The font formatting should apply immediately when you save the template. If you're still having issues after trying these steps, the problem might be with how the text was originally entered into the template.

subject: Mojo Dialer
botResponse: Mojo Dialer is a comprehensive prospecting and sales platform designed to elevate your business and take your follow-up to the next level. Here's what makes it powerful: ## Core Features **Advanced Dialing Technology** - State-of-the-art technology over analog telecom layer (not VoIP) for superior audio quality and better first hello answers - Power Dialer and Click-to-Call options for flexible calling approaches - Multi-line dialing capability (up to triple line dialer) - Complimentary caller ID whitelisting to avoid spam tagging **Comprehensive CRM Integration** - Industry-leading dialing interface with fully customizable experience - Organize data into lists, groups, and action plans - Automate prospecting lists and sales pipeline management - Group leads by outcomes, schedule appointments, create tasks **Built-in Tools & Features** - Call recording for quality assurance (optional add-on, 90-day retention) - Six high-quality data and lead sources in the U.S. - Prospecting Dashboard for setting goals and tracking progress - Mobile apps for on-the-go prospecting, caller ID, and door knocking - Assign action plans for drip email and follow-up campaigns ## Dialing Modes **Power Dialer Mode**: High-volume calling with multiple simultaneous lines, automated progression through your contact list, and configurable settings for maximum efficiency. **Click-to-Call Mode**: Manual, one-by-one dialing for more deliberate conversations when you need greater control over each interaction. The platform is designed for sales professionals who need a robust, reliable system for prospecting and lead management, combining powerful technology with user-friendly features to maximize your calling productivity.

subject: multiple users
description: Can multiple users on the same account dial at the same time?
botResponse: Yes, multiple users on the same Mojo account can dial at the same time, but you'll need the proper setup: **What You Need:** - Each user needs their own Agent Access License - Each user who wants to dial simultaneously needs their own separate Dialer License **How It Works:** - Agent Access Licenses give users access to the Mojo system - Dialer Licenses allow users to actually use the Power Dialer - Data products (like lead lists) are shared across all users on the same account **Example:** If you have 3 agents and want all of them to be able to dial at the same time, you would need: - 3 Agent Access Licenses (one per user) - 3 Dialer Licenses (one per simultaneous dialer user) **Shared Features:** - All users can access the same lead lists and data - Calling profiles can be shared between users - Activity streams show everyone's activities for better team coordination The pricing is flexible with no contracts and simple monthly billing, so you can adjust your licenses based on your team's needs.

subject: Missing a Call Recording for Gregory Seebaldt - checking with Andrew
botResponse: I can help you understand how call recordings work in Mojo and what might cause recordings to be missing. Call recordings in Mojo are automatically saved for calls that end with these specific results: - Contact - DNC Contact - DNC Number Here are the most common reasons why a call recording might be missing: **Possible Causes:** 1. **Call Result** - The call may have ended with a different result that doesn't trigger recording (like No Answer, Busy, etc.) 2. **Recording Feature Assignment** - The Call Recording feature may not have been assigned to the agent who made the call 3. **Audio Connection Issues** - Technical problems during the call could prevent proper recording **How to Check:** 1. **Verify the call result** in Gregory Seebaldt's contact record under the History section 2. **Confirm the agent had Call Recording enabled** during that dialing session 3. **Check the Call Recording Report** (Reports â†’ Call Recording) for that specific date and agent **Where to Look for Recordings:** - Call Recording Report (Reports menu) - Individual contact record (Gregory Seebaldt's History section) **Important Notes:** - Recordings are automatically deleted after 90 days - The Call Recording feature needs to be specifically assigned to each agent - Feature changes take effect on the next dial session the agent begins If the call should have been recorded based on the result and the agent had the feature enabled, there may have been a technical issue during that specific call.
